alert.note: Alert for Inland Worcester; Maryland Beaches; Somerset; Wicomico (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 11 at 11:06PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of Somerset, Wicomico and Worcester Counties through MIDNIGHT EST... At 1105 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from near Delmar to 7 miles southwest of Hebron to 6 miles northwest of Deal Island. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Gusty showers will be near... Delmar, Delmar and Hebron around 1110 PM EST. Fruitland around 1115 PM EST. Salisbury and Salisbury University around 1120 PM EST. Princess Anne, University Of Maryland Eastern Shore, Parsonsburg and Westover around 1125 PM EST. Ocean Pines around 1130 PM EST. West Pocomoke around 1135 PM EST. Berlin and Snow Hill around 1145 PM EST. Ocean City, Newark and Cape Isle Of Wight around 1150 PM EST. Other locations impacted by these showers include Bishop, Wetipquin, Ocean City Municipality, Trinity, Cokesbury, Goodwill, Eden, Longridge, Cedartown and Mount Vernon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these showers. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Inland Worcester; Maryland Beaches; Somerset; Wicomico
